properties.Name: 1035TaxCodeStatus
properties.Description:
The unique identifier of a Section 1035 of the Tax Code transfer for another 'like-kind' policy status.   

Normally when an individual realizes a gain on a financial transaction then that gain is taxed.

If a policyholder surrenders a life insurance policy and receives the cash value, then they will realize a gain to the extent that the cash value exceeds the amount of premiums paid.   That gain is considered ordinary income and is fully taxable.   If a policy is exchanged for another then Section 1035 of the Tax Code stipulates that no gain or loss will be recognized.   Therefore the transaction is not subject to any tax.

The following kinds of exchanges are allowed under this provision:

(1)  A life insurance policy for another life insurance policy, endowment policy or annuity contract

(2)  An endowment policy for an annuity contract

(3)  An annuity contract for another annuity contract
